8100.name: Newbie Area - Information Room [OOC]
8100.description:
Name - Newbie School
Author - Shadwen/Zoie
Purpose - The first place players are sent to after character creation.
Here, they learn all the basic commands of Njata and get an idea of what
kind of game we're running.

8101.name: Welcome to Njata! [OOC]
8101.description:
Welcome to Njata, traveler! Feel free to venture through our mud school in
order to learn how we differ from other experiences you may be used to.
Whether new to Muds or a grizzled veteran, make certain to read the room
descriptions here or else things may get confusing very quickly! If you
have visited this school before, or feel you need no help. Feel free to
enter the portal downwards.

8102.name: Learning About Yourself [OOC]
8102.description:
Here is where you will learn more about yourself. Type [score] to see
information about your character, [equipment] will show you your worn
equipment, and [inventory] will show you what you're currently carrying.
As an option, you may explore our world with a map and compass to guide
you. Type [config +automap] and [config +compass] to turn these features
on. When you are ready to proceed, head [east].

8103.name: Becoming Acquainted with Skills [OOC]
8103.description:
To learn the abilities that you are capable of performing and how practiced
you are in them, type of one of the following: [Skills] will show you your
learned non-magic abilities. [Spells] will show you which spells you've
learned. [Proficiencies] will show you what weapons you're capable of
handling with any degree of skill. You may wish to shorten that to [Prof],
most commands can be shortened in Njata for your convenience! You can type
[Slist] to learn what powers will become available to you as you level up,
but most skills will have to be learned from the appropriate teacher. If
you happen to be a Scholar, then do not fret. You will have to find relics
to [study] to learn your spells, so make sure to look in every nook and
cranny of the world.

8104.name: Getting Equipped for the First Time [OOC]
8104.description:
Here is where you can get started on your journey, Simply [say gear me] and
Brutus will hand you a good starting set. The races of Njata have diverse
body types and thus have different equipment requirements. Some dont even
have FEET! These items should fit any race and class, but keep that in
mind when travelling the world. When you are ready to try on what Brutus
has given you, [wear armor] will allow you to put on the armor, [wear
cloak] will allow you to don the cloak, and so on. The backpack is a
special type of item called a container. Try storing the waterskin in your
backpack now with  [put waterskin backpack]. When you grow thirsty, you
can [get waterskin backpack] to retrieve it, and [drink waterskin] to take
a drink. Proceed to the north when you are ready to learn more.

8105.name: In-Character Communication [OOC]
8105.description:
Now that you know about the out-of-character communication channels, it's
time to learn about the channels used for in-character communication. To
speak to an entire room of people, you need only [Say] your message. Some
jolly people may prefer to [Sing] their message instead, however. To
direct your message to a specific person while still allowing the whole
room to hear it, you can [Sayto]. For more private conversations, you can
[Whisper] to a person and they will be the only one to hear your message.
If you really need to get the attention of people nearby, you can [Yell]
what you want to say. Yelling, while rude in some situations, can be very
useful to get the message across a longer distance than merely saying it.

8106.name: Describing Your Hair and Eyes [OOC]
8106.description:
With all that out of the way, it's time to get down to business.  We still
don't even know what you look like! Here, you will learn how to remedy
that. Type [Hair] followed by a description to describe how your hair will
appear to those who look at you. For example, if you wanted to have coarse
brown hair, you would type [Hair coarse brown hair] and anyone who looks
at you would see He/She/It has coarse brown hair. Now to describe your
eyes, type [Eyes] followed by a description. Remember to make certain that
these descriptions make sense for your race. Dragons should skip
describing their hair, unless they wanted to use that opportunity to
describe their horns, pattern, etc.

8107.name: Your First Taste of Battle [OOC]
8107.description:
Combat can be very dangerous and very thrilling, but it's important to
remember, it's not the only option. If you decide to engage in battle,
classes have special abilities to use during combat, and some races have
natural weapons or special attacks. To begin attacking something, simply
type [Kill] followed by the name of your target. Always remember to
[Consider] a target before you attack it, if you're unfamiliar with its
capabilities. Try it out! [Consider dummy], then it you feel you can
defeat it, [Kill dummy].

8108.name: The Final Consideration [OOC]
8108.description:
Now you know the basics of what is required to survive and thrive in Njata,
but before you go, we must talk about the rules. Rules are what  hold this
game together, They are something you should know and abide  by. Please
[Help RULES] and make sure you know and follow them. When you are ready to
continue your adventure, [Say I agree to follow all rules]

8109.name: Out-of-Character Communication [OOC]
8109.description:
Channels allow you to speak with other people in Njata, a very important
part. If you find yourself confused by anything, feel free to [Ask] about
it. Know the answer to a question? then you can [Answer] the individual.
If you just want to socialize with others, then you can [Chat] with them.
To speak to a single person, you may [Tell (person) (message)]. All of
these channels are for out-of-character communication. If you ever grow
tired of hearing what others have to say, you can turn channels off. Type
[channels] to see a list of channels, and to turn the shout channel off,
for example, you would type [chan -shout]. To turn it back on, you'd need
only type [chan +shout].

8110.name: Describing Yourself Further [OOC]
8110.description:
Now that your hair and eyes are described, perhaps you wish to describe
yourself a little further? Here is a [Scroll], if you [Look scroll] you
will see a list of body types available to you. Once you have decided upon
your figure, then you would like to try your hand at a more advanced
description. To write a freeform description, type [Desc]. This will enter
you into a buffer where you can write anything you please, but please keep
it within the limits of an appearance reasonable for your race. Humans can
have hair dyed any color they please, but should never have wings!

exdescs.scroll:
regular, lithe, thin, rotund, curvaceous,
voluptuous, pear-shaped, fat, corpulent,
starved, lanky, muscular, stocky, toned, wiry

[say] one of them to decide.
e.g. [say stocky]

8111.name: Choose a Specialty, Elementalist [OOC]
8111.description:
In Njata, Elementalists choose to specialize in one of the Six Elements:
Fire, Water, Air, Earth, Life, and Darkness. To learn about the elements,
and their differences, Type [Help Elements]. When you have made your
decision, say the name of the element and you will proceed into the World
of Njata.
